TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in LANGUAGE .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE administrative proceedings started concerning the grant of a building permit to the applicants ' neighbours . In pursuit of the applicants ' administrative appeals and their ensuing request for judicial review dated DATE , on DATE the ORG quashed the existing decisions and remitted the case to the second - instance administrative authority . CARDINAL . In the resumed administrative proceedings , on DATE ORG remitted the case to ORG . It appears that , by this time , the neighbours had already constructed the building in question . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants ' appeal in which they had requested the removal of part of the building , constructed irregularly in their view .

CARDINAL . Due to a change in the law , in the resumed judicial review proceedings ORG heard the case as a first - instance court . On DATE it ordered the administrative instances to resume the proceedings , because their previous decisions had approved some irregular plans . On DATE ORG , sitting as a second - instance court , upheld this decision .

CARDINAL . In the resumed administrative proceedings , on DATE ORG granted the neighbours a permit for the continued existence of the building in question . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants ' appeal in which they had alleged that the building had been constructed in defiance of the regulations and that its continued existence infringed their rights as neighbours .

CARDINAL . In judicial review proceedings , on DATE ORG dismissed the applicants ' action . The court pointed out that , under LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE on Construction , the authority in charge of construction may take measures in respect of an irregularly constructed building within DATE from its taking cognisance of the irregularity but in any event not DATE from the certification of the building for use . In the court 's view , the DATE time - limit had been triggered by ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE ; therefore – the DATE time - limit having been elapsed DATE the neighbours could no longer be denied a permit for the continued existence of the building in question .

CARDINAL . NORP This decision was upheld by ORG appeal bench on DATE . It stressed that DATE contrary to what was apparently argued by the applicants – the running of the DATE time - limit had not been interrupted by the review proceedings in which the decision of CARDINAL DATE had been quashed , because its execution had not been suspended .
